main_definition: To climb or ascend, especially a steep slope or hill; to increase in number or quantity.

meanings_and_examples.example: She managed to mount the horse effortlessly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To add, increase, or raise in quantity or level
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to mount a new marketing campaign.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specific location, especially on a mountain
meanings_and_examples.example: We reached the summit of Mount Everest after days of climbing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To record (a sound) using an audio device
meanings_and_examples.example: The cameraman mounted a microphone to capture the speeches at the conference.
